gurmukhi: ieqy rudR mn mMqR ibcwrXo ] sRI jdupiq ky inkit aucwrXo ] Ab hI miRqih Awiesu dIjY ] qb ieh BUp mwir kY lIjY ]1696]
transliteration: Ite Rudra Man Mantra Bichdaryo|| Srijadhpat(i) Ke Nikattee Ouchdaryo|| Ab Himritah(i) Aaes(u) Deejai|| Tab Eh Bhoop Daar(i) Kai Leejai||1696||
translation: Reflecting in his mind, Shiva said to Krishna, “Commend death now to kill the king.1696.

gurmukhi: sr ApnY mY miRqu Dir ieh qum krhu aupwie ] Ab kis kY Dnu CwfIey BUly bif AinAwie ]1697]
transliteration: Sar Apnai Mar Mrit(u) Dhar(i) Eh Toumdaroh Oupaae|| Ab Kas(i) Dhan(u) Chhaadeee Bhoole Bad(i) Aniaae||1697||
translation: “Take the step of getting Death seated in your arrow and pulling the bow, discharge the arrow so that this king may forget doing all acts of injustice.”1697.

gurmukhi: soeI kwm sXwm jU kIno ] ijh ibD soN iSvjU kih dIno ] qb icqvn hir miRq ko kIXo ] mIc Awie kY drSnu dIXo ]1698]
transliteration: Soikaam Syaam Joo Keeno|| Jih Bidh Son Shivjoo Kah(i) Deeno|| Tah Chitvan Har(i) Mrit Ko Keeyo, Meech Aae Kai Darshan(u) Deeyo|| 1698||
translation: Krishna acted according to the suggestion of Shiva; Krishna thought of death and the god of death manifested himself.1698.

gurmukhi: khXO miRq ko kiRSn jU mo sr mY kr bwsu ] Ab Cwfq hoN S`qR pY jwie krhu iqh nwsu ]1699]
transliteration: Kahyau Mrit Ko Krishan Joo Mo Sar Mai Kar Baas Chhaadat Hon Shattra Pai Jaaedaroh Tih Naas(u)||699||
translation: Krishna said to the god of death, “Abide in my arrow and on my discharging the arrow, you may destroy the enemy.”1699.

gurmukhi: dyv bDUn kY nYn ktwC iblokq hI niRp ic`q luBwXo ] nwrd bHm duhU imil ky rn mY sMg bwqn ky aurJwXo ]
transliteration: Dev Badhounkai Nain Kataachh Bilokat Hinrip Chhitt Loubhaay|| Naarad Brahm Duhoo Mil(i) Ke Ran Mai Sag Baatan Ke Urjhaayo||
translation: The king was allured by the side-glances of the heavenly damseld; on this side Narada and Brahma together engrossed the king in their talk;

gurmukhi: sXwm qbY liK Gwq BlI Air mwrn ko miRq bwn clwXo ] mMqRin ky bl soN Cl soN qb BUpiq ko isr kwt igrwXo ]1700]
transliteration: Syaam Tabai Lakhi) Ghaat Bhaleeari) Maaran Ko Mrit Baan Chalaayo|| Mantran 9i0 Ke Bal Son Chhal Son Tab Boopat(i) Ko Sir Kaat Giray||1700||
translation: At the same time, seeing a good opportunity, Krishna discharged his death-arrow and with the force of mantras deceptively caused the head of the king to fall down.1700.

gurmukhi: jidip sIs ktXo n htXo gih kysin qy hir Er clwXo ] mwnhu pRwn clXo idv Awnn kwj ibdw biRjrwj pY AwXo ]
transliteration: Jadip(i) Sees Katyo Na Hatyo Gadh Kesan(i) Te Har(i) Or Chalaayo|| Maanoh Praan Chaly Div Aanan Kaaj Bidaa Brijraaj Pai Aayo||
translation: Though the head of the king was cut, but still he remained stable and catching his head from his hair, he threw it towards Krishna; it seemed as if his pranas (vital force) had reached Krishna in order to bid farewell to him;

gurmukhi: so isr lwg gXo hir ky aur mUrC hÍY pgu nw ThrwXo ] dyKhu paurK BUp ky muMf ko sXMdn qy pRB BUm igrwXo ]1701]
transliteration: So Sir Laag Gado Har(i) Ke Ur Moondachh Hvai Pag(u) Naa Thahraayo|| Dekhoh Paurakh Bhoop Ke Mounnd Ko Syandan Te Prabh Bhoom Giraayo||1701||
translation: That head hit Krishna and he could not keep standing; he fell down unconscious; see the bravery of the head of the king; on being hit by it, the Lord (Krishna) fell down from his chariot on the earth.1701.
